title: Is Israel running out of goodwill?
description: U.S. support of Israel’s war in Gaza has been unwavering – but as the civilian death toll climbs, international calls for a ceasefire are growing. Today, the mounting concern over Israel’s tactics and how the Biden administration is responding.

title: Running short on Ukraine air defenses, U.S. looks to Japan
description: Tokyo is preparing a significant policy shift in its defense export rules that would allow Washington to transfer additional Patriot missiles to Kyiv.

title: Security Council searching for a Gaza vote that U.S. won’t veto
description: The U.N. seeks a resolution amendable to Washington that could call for a stop to fighting in Gaza and allow in humanitarian aid.

title: Indian citizen denies charges of murder for hire on U.S. soil
description: A lawyer for Nikhil Gupta says his arrest on assassination plot charges is a case of mistaken identity and that her client is a victim of geopolitical “cross-fire.”

title: With Navalny’s whereabouts still unknown, Kremlin targets novelist Akunin
description: As Russia sharpens repression of critics, the jailed opposition leader Alexei Navalny is missing in the prison system, and Boris Akunin, a writer of detective novels, has been branded a terrorist for criticizing the war against Ukraine.

title: Egypt under growing pressure as displaced Gazans crowd the border
description: Egypt has steadfastly refused to take in refugees from Gaza, but the deteriorating humanitarian situation along the border may ultimately force Cairo’s hand.

title: Zelensky to face questions over faltered counteroffensive, other setbacks
description: The Ukrainian president is due to hold a year-end news conference amid reports of shortages of troops and ammunition in the defense against Russia’s invasion.

title: In photos: An earthquake in northwestern China kills over a 100 people
description: A major earthquake rocked a mountainous area of northwestern China just before midnight on Monday, bringing buildings crashing down on people as they slept.

title: New U.S.-led Red Sea task force won’t stop shipping attacks, Houthis say
description: Yemen’s Houthi rebels say they’ll continue Red Sea attacks on commercial ships amid the Israel-Gaza war despite the formation of a U.S.-led maritime task force.

title: Paramilitary force takes city in heart of Sudan’s breadbasket, 300,000 flee
description: Wad Madani, south of the capital of Khartoum, had been an area of relative security for the last eight months of fighting and one of the few havens for humanitarian operations.

title: In photos and videos: Iceland volcano spews lava in dramatic eruption
description: Thousands in the town of Grindavik have evacuated, and the operator of a nearby power plant said it was controlling it remotely while monitoring the lava flow.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Austin says Israel has ‘moral duty’ to protect civilians; hostage talks resume
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin urged Israel to protect civilians as the death toll in Gaza approaches 20,000.

title: Moscow glows triumphant as front freezes and Western aid for Ukraine stalls
description: Despite nearly two years of war and reports of more than 300,000 casualties in Ukraine, the Russian capital is in a holiday spirit and the Kremlin is projecting confidence.

title: Houthi attacks on shipping threaten global consequences
description: Trade is being disrupted not by an accident, but by the deliberate actions of an armed group. The result could be a protracted impact on trade or worse.

title: Earthquake in north-western China kills at least 111 people
description: A 6.2 magnitude earthquake struck Gansu and Qinghai provinces in north-west China just before midnight Monday. A rescue effort is now underway.
